School Chronicles

    Bernardo Vasquez Community School was named after the school site Bernardo Vasquez in early 1950’s which believed. The first schooling was done on the donor’s house.

February 5, 1976

    The couple Ramon Dubduban and Ester Vasquez Dubduban heirs of Bernardo Vasquez executed a Deed of Donation in addition to the existing school site area of about Five thousand square meters for the four classroom building donated by JICA to the City Government of Surigao through the Donne represented by The City Mayor Atty. Pedro Espina. Bernardo Vasquez Community School was later changed to Bernardo Vasquez Memorial Central Elementary after new districts were created. Bernardo Vasquez Memorial Central Elementary shared its lot/campus to Rizal National High School. It is now the central school of District VI under the School Principal II Mr. Zosimo H. Lopez, Jr. the District VI is composed of eight elementary schools and two secondary schools lead by the District VI Supervisor Mrs. Claire Eloise V. Ortega.

THE DEPED VISION


We dream of Filipinos who passionately love their country and whose values and competencies enable them to realize their full potential and contribute meaningfully to building the nation. As a learner-centered public institution, the Department of Education continuously improves itself to better serve its stakeholders..

THE DEPED MISSION


To protect and promote the right of every Filipino to quality, equitable, culture-based, and complete basic education where: Students learn in a child-friendly, gender-sensitive, safe, and motivating environment. Teachers facilitate learning and constantly nurture every learner. Administrators and staff, as stewards of the institution, ensure an enabling and supportive environment for effective learning to happen. Family, community, and other stakeholders are actively engaged and share responsibility for developing life-long learners.

OUR CORE VALUES


Maka-Diyos
Maka-tao
Makakalikasan
Makabansa
